definition:
A *cevian* of a triangle, is any line segment joining a vertex with a
point of the opposite side.

![image](cevian)

$AD$ is a cevian of $\triangle ABC$.

If $D$ is the midpoint of $BC$, then the cevian $AD$ is a *median*. If
$AD$ is perpendicular to $BC$, then the cevian is a *height*.
